title: Creamy Scalloped Potatoes (Gratin Dauphinoise Calluanud)
ingredients: 2¼ pounds of boiling potatoes, peeled and sliced into ⅛-inch thick round slices
a pinch of freshly grated nutmeg
instructions: In a bowl, toss the potatoes with 2 teaspoons of salt, and let them stand for 10 minutes.  Combine well the garlic and 2 tablespoons of the butter, softened, and spread the mixture in a flameproof baking dish (14 by 10 inches, 2 inches deep).  In a saucepan scald the cream and the milk with the remaining 2 teaspoons of salt, the pepper, and the nutmeg.  Drain the potatoes and pat them dry.  Thinly slice the remaining 12 tablespoons of butter and cover the bottom of the baking dish with the slices.  Ladle some of the cream mixture over the butter and top it with a layer of the potatoes.   Layer the remaining cream mixture and potatoes, and bring the mixture to a boil on top of the stove.  Remove and place in the oven to bake the dish in a preheated 400° F. oven for 20 to 25 minutes, or until the potatoes are tender and browned lightly.
Let the dish cool a good 10 minutes before bringing it to the table.
Remarks:  Use a baking sheet under the baking dish to catch any drippings in the oven.
Source:  You Asked For It, Gourmet Magazine, October 1984.
